definitions.text: the process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid
examples: the power failure caused a refrigerator melt that was a disaster
the thawing of a frozen turkey takes several hours

definitions.text: reduce or cause to be reduced from a solid to a liquid state, usually by heating
examples: The wax melted in the sun

definitions.text: become or cause to become soft or liquid
examples: The giant iceberg dissolved over the years during the global warming phase

definitions.text: become more relaxed, easygoing, or genial
lose its distinct outline or shape; blend gradually
examples: Hundreds of actors were melting into the scene

definitions.text: become less clearly visible or distinguishable; disappear gradually or seemingly
examples: The tree trunks are melting into the forest at dusk

definitions.text: become less intense and fade away gradually
examples: her resistance melted under his charm
her hopes evaporated after years of waiting for her fiance
